yelp_reviews.author: Jung Y.
yelp_reviews.review:
Got yet ANOTHER text today for the SAME address (4802 North Foxglove Dr. NW), from yet a different spoofed/fake phone number and likely shell "company".  

I thought I got rid of this VD, but apparently not. STOP this harassment!

yelp_reviews.author: S S.
yelp_reviews.review:
STAY AWAY!
If I could give zero stars I would.
They offer you a good market value, then they drag you along, and then they offer you less than 50% of their initial offer, which is 30% of actual value.
THEY ARE UNETHICAL!

yelp_reviews.author: John N.
yelp_reviews.review: Unethical vultures. They continue to call, text, and send post cards despite repeated requests to stop.  I am on the FTC Do Not Call list, and they repeatedly violate it.

yelp_reviews.author: Jeff S.
yelp_reviews.review: Two calls last week and this afternoon alone, received 2 phone calls and a text from someone at this "company" leaving messages stating that they wanted to speak to me about my home. Home is not for sale, there is no interest in selling anytime soon and have ZERO interest in doing any business with them. Continued harassment will result in complaints being filed with local and state officials.

yelp_reviews.author: Xena F.
yelp_reviews.review:
Irresponsible advertising techniques used to scrounge up business!!

Their "3rd Notice" postcard regarding "the property at (my home address) due to some important things that have come up with the property" concerned my teen son, (who had picked up the mail early in the morning), enough to wake me up, worried we were going to lose our home or had a serious urgent property issue happening.  More wording on the card stressed the importance of not delaying and multiple attempts to reach me.

Nowhere in the postcard was mentioned from which agency or company this "3rd Notice" on a bright yellow postcard was - just "Alex", a phone number and PO Box in Bham. 

Called and it turns out they are a buy-your-house-for-cash business.  "Alex" was a woman's voice on an answering machine.

No thank you - I will use a bonafide Realtor (held to a level of professional ethics) when it's time to sell my home.  You don't need to stoop low and use slimey scare-tactic advertising techniques to drum up business.  I'll give my business to someone honorable who actually works for it.  Quit bothering and worrying people unnecessarily.

yelp_reviews.author: Stephen D.
yelp_reviews.review:
ridiculous and annoying having to block 5 different calling phone numbers.

just calls no mail yet--thank ya jesus

yelp_reviews.author: Nancy C.
yelp_reviews.review: Someone from this place keeps sending me mail saying he wants to buy my house. I am not selling my house and I am tired of his annoying junk mail.

ownerResponse.text:
Hi Nancy, 
Sorry for the mailer we sent ya. We were looking to buy some houses/property in the area so thought that we sent you one to see if you are interested in selling as we are not sure who want to sell or not. We are sorry for the inconvenience. 

Sorry and Thank you.

yelp_reviews.author: Kim W.
yelp_reviews.review: We keep getting these urgent notices saying it is important for us to call them. We are not selling our house, especially for pennies on the dollar. Tired of getting these. I want them to stop.
